Class WorldMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • WorldMap

  • public class WorldMap
extends Object
    This class provides functionality to draw the graphical world map during a Darwin simulation. Before any other operations can be performed, the starting map must be initialized by calling WorldMap.initialize(width, height).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void clearSquare(Position pos)
      Clear the contents of the square at the given position.
      static void drawCreature(Creature creature)
      Draw the given creature at the square indicated by its current position.
      static void drawMovedCreature(Creature creature, Position prevPos)
      Re-draw a creature that just moved.
      static void initialize(int width, int height)
      Initialize the world map of the specified size and display the window for it.
      static void pause(long durationMs)
      Pause the simulation for the given duration.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • clearSquare

        public static void clearSquare(Position pos)
        Clear the contents of the square at the given position.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position of the square to clear.

      • drawCreature

        public static void drawCreature(Creature creature)
        Draw the given creature at the square indicated by its current position. Creatures are drawn as a colored arrow (of the species's color) with the first letter of the species's name, pointing in the creature's current direction. Any existing contents drawn at the square to update are overwritten. This method does *not* affect any other square at which the creature may have previously been drawn.
        Parameters:
        creature - The creature to draw.

      • drawMovedCreature

        public static void drawMovedCreature(Creature creature,
                                     Position prevPos)
        Re-draw a creature that just moved. Functionally identical to calling drawCreature(creature) followed by clearSquare(prevPos), but produces a smoother transition with less image flicker. Produces an error if the given creature is located at the same position as the square to clear.
        Parameters:
        creature - The creature to draw.
        prevPos - The position of the square to clear.

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(int width,
                              int height)
        Initialize the world map of the specified size and display the window for it. This must be called once and only once, before calling any other WorldMap operations. Produces an error if called multiple times.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the world (1 to 30).
        height - The height of the world (1 to 30).

      • pause

        public static void pause(long durationMs)
        Pause the simulation for the given duration. This should be called periodically to prevent the simulation from completing instantly.
        Parameters:
        durationMs - The duration to pause, in milliseconds.
